cit:title.gco:CharacterString: IMOS National Reference Station (NRS) - Salinity, Carbon, Alkalinity, Oxygen and Nutrients (Silicate, Ammonium, Nitrite/Nitrate, Phosphate)

cit:alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: National Reference Stations - Salinity, Carbon, Alkalinity, Oxygen and Nutrients

cit:name.gco:CharacterString: Website of the Integrated Marine Observing System (IMOS)
Website of the Integrated Marine Observing System (IMOS)

mri:abstract.gco:CharacterString: These data sets include Salinity, Carbon, Alkalinity, Oxygen and Nutrients (Silicate, Ammonium, Nitrite/Nitrate, Phosphate) analysed from samples collected as part of the Integrated Marine Observing Systems (IMOS) National Mooring Network -National Reference Station (NRS) field sampling. Nine Sites are included in the IMOS NRS field sampling stations. Maria Island (TAS), Kangaroo Island (SA), Esperance (WA), Rottnest Island (WA), Ningaloo (WA), Darwin (NT), Yongala (QLD), North Stradbroke Island (QLD) and Port Hacking 100 (NSW). Sampling at these sites is conducted by several members of IMOS NRS Biogeochemical project. Sampling at the sites began between 29/9/2008 and 8/11/2010 and is currently ongoing for 7 sites. Sampling ceased at Ningaloo and Esperance (WA) sites in Aug/Sept 2013. Sampling is conducted monthly (Esperance and Ningaloo were 3 monthly) off small vessels. Details including information on station locations, depths sampled, sample regime, sample types collected, and analyses can be found in the “IMOS National Reference Stations Biogeochemical Operations Manual” (see link below to latest version, plus link to previous versions and supplementary documentation). Historical data collected as part of CSIRO Coastal Monitoring program is available for three of the National Reference Station sites: Maria Island Coastal Station Data 1944-2008, Port Hacking 100m Coastal Station Data 1953-2010 and Rottnest Island Coastal Station Data 1951-2009. Additional information for this dataset may be available via the original MarLIN metadata entry: https://marlin.csiro.au/geonetwork/srv/eng/catalog.search#/metadata/fa93c66e-0e56-7e1d-e043-08114f8c1b76. The links to the metadata and access for these data is provided below. Data storage and access is planned to be interoperable with other national and international programs through the IMOS Infrastructure. Station metadata can be found through this resource. **This dataset has been superseded by the "IMOS - Combined Biogeochemical parameters (reference stations)" collection that is available at https://catalogue-imos.aodn.org.au/geonetwork/srv/api/records/b442c3e8-3d30-48ad-b144-680afd848167 (this collection was removed from the AODN Portal in February 2022).**

mri:credit.gco:CharacterString: These data are from the National Mooring Network, part of the Australia’s Integrated Marine Observing System (IMOS) is enabled by the National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS). It is operated by a consortium of institutions as an unincorporated joint venture, with the University of Tasmania as Lead Agent.

Operation of the National Reference Station (NRS) sampling and analyses is provided by the IMOS NRS Biogeochemical (BGC) project and is distributed between several operators and is coordinated nationally. Nutrient analyses (2009- ) performed by Val Latham (CMAR - Hobart) and Peter Hughes (CMAR - Floreat) Salinity and oxygen analyses (2009- ) performed by Val Latham (CMAR - Hobart) Carbon and Alkalinity analyses (2009- ) performed by Kate Berry (CMAR - Hobart)

cit:title.gco:CharacterString: Olsen, L.M., G. Major, K. Shein, J. Scialdone, R. Vogel, S. Leicester, H. Weir, S. Ritz, T. Stevens, M. Meaux, C.Solomon, R. Bilodeau, M. Holland, T. Northcutt, R. A. Restrepo, 2007. NASA/Global Change Master Directory (GCMD) Earth Science Keywords. Version 6.0.0.0.0

mco:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This material is released under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International licence. The citation in a list of references is: "IMOS [year-of-data-download], [Title], [data-access-URL], accessed [date-of-access]." Any users of IMOS data are required to clearly acknowledge the source of the material derived from IMOS in the format: "Data was sourced from Australia’s Integrated Marine Observing System (IMOS) – IMOS is enabled by the National Collaborative Research Infrastructure strategy (NCRIS)."

cit:title.gco:CharacterString: Lynch, T.P., Roughan, M., Mclaughlan, D., Hughes, D., Cherry, D., Critchley, G., Allen, S., Pender, L., Thompson, P., Richardson, A.J., Coman, F., Steinberg, C., Terhell, D., Seuront, L., Mclean, C., Brinkman, G. and G. Meyers A. 2008. National Reference Station infrastructure for Australia: Using telemetry and central processing to report multi-disciplinary data streams for monitoring marine ecosystem response to climate change. Accepted June 2008 Oceans 2008.
IMOS National Reference Stations Biogeochemical Operations Manual

mri:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: ATTRIBUTE STATEMENT: NRS_TRIP_CODE - Trip Identifier to enable all the different samples taken on trip to be found in each set of data NRS_SAMPLE_CODE - Sample Identifier STATION_NAME - Sampling Station Name IMOS_SITE_CODE - IMOS sampling site reference, in the format NRSxxx UTC_TRIP_START_TIME - Time in UTC at the start of the sampling program LOCAL_TRIP_START_TIME - Local time at the start of the sampling program SAMPLE_DEPTH_M - Depth Sampled with Niskin - the same depth will have been sampled for a number of analyses SALINITY - result of salinity analysis for this sample (usually reported as a number without units) SALINITY_FLAG - IMOS Data Quality Flag Code for the salinity result from this sample SALINITY_COMMENTS - Comments usually related to Data Quality SILICATE_UMOL_PER_L - Result of Silicate Analysis for this Sample in Micromols Per Litre (µmol l-1) SILICATE_FLAG - IMOS Data Quality Flag Code for the silicate result from this sample NITRATE_UMOL_PER_L - Result of Nitrate/Nitrite Analysis for this Sample in Micromols Per Litre (µmol l-1) NITRATE_FLAG - IMOS Data Quality Flag Code for the Nitrate/Nitrite Result from this Sample PHOSPHATE_UMOL_PER_L - Result of Phosphate Analysis for this Sample in Micromols Per Litre (µmol l-1) PHOSPHATE_FLAG - IMOS Data Quality Flag Code for the Phosphate result from this Sample AMMONIUM_UMOL_PER_L - Result of Ammonium Analysis for this Sample in Micromols Per Litre (µmol l-1) AMMONIUM_FLAG - Imos Data Quality Flag Code for the Ammonium Result from this Sample NUTRIENT_COMMENTS - Comments usually related to Data Quality TCO2_UMOL_PER_KG - Total dissolved inorganic carbon (TCO2), also known as DIC or CT - Precision and accuracy estimate: ±1 μmol kg-1 CARBON_FLAG - Imos Data Quality Flag Code for the Carbon Result from this Sample CARBON_COMMENTS - Comments usually related to Data Quality TALKALINITY_UMOL_PER_KG - Total Alkalinity in μmol kg-1 precision and accuracy estimate ±2 μmol kg-1 ALKALINITY_FLAG - Imos Data Quality Flag Code for the Alkalinity Result from this Sample ALKALINITY_COMMENTS - Comments usually related to Data Quality OXYGEN_UMOL_PER_L - Dissolved oxygen in μmol l-1 OXYGEN_FLAG - Imos Data Quality Flag Code for the Oxygen Result from this Sample OXYGEN_COMMENTS - Comments usually related to Data Quality STATION_PT - Station Location in spatial format (EPSG:4326)

mdq:explanation.gco:CharacterString: Please refer to the Quality Control Flags provided with the data.
Dataset collection is ongoing. Please refer to quality flags provided with the data.

mrl:statement.gco:CharacterString: Sampling is conducted monthly (Esperance and Ningaloo 3 monthly) off small vessels. Depths sampled range from surface to 105 metres depending on the site and depths are usually sampled at 10 metre intervals. The nutrient analyses is performed at CMAR Hobart and Floreat laboratories. Full details are documented in the “IMOS National Reference Stations Biogeochemical Operations Manual”. Data is archived in the ORABN1:PLANKTON_NRS_ENV database at CMAR Dutton Park. Data is also exported to IMOS and made available via the AODN portal.
